title: I have been told by many that I'm hard to read. What does that mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cheng Ying, You personally requested my interpretation, so I will express my views somewhat boldly, rendering several ‘assumptions’. You remain ‘hard to read’ as you tend not to express your emotional state – for several reasons, or rather ‘causes’. Your heritage. 1. You are ‘Asian’, possibly first generation in the ‘west’? As such, you are ‘reserved’ - uncertain of just ‘how’ you will be perceived due to western ‘socio/cultural’ bias. You desire not to ‘offend’, you really have no idea just what would be deemed ‘offensive’. 2. Your ‘parent culture’ is, by western standards, very old and established. Your conditioned temperament is quietly reserved, muted; You appear as withdrawn, uncommunicative. Contrarily, westerners are, by disposition, actively expressive, and emotionally communicative, fluctuating frequently. What with all the social turbulence in the west, the citizenry is especially insecure, agitated, even unto volatile – And they expect others to ‘be just like themselves’. 3. Do to the above causes, you do not easily engage in ‘small talk’ - For you remain uncertain just ‘how’ you should engage in this western propensity to express themselves emotionally. Do not despair unnecessarily. I am a Stoic Scandinavian, also unwilling to engage in emotional rhetoric. I am frequently viewed much the same as I ascribed unto you. I remain largely unconcerned. If you consider my interpretation is invalid or incorrect, kindly contact me via Quora, and I would appreciate all insights you may present. As the imperturbable Vulcan ‘Mr. Spock’ of “Star Trek” would exclaim: “Live long and prosper”. Just a Thought . . . To Ponder The Potentials of: ‘Well Being’. 🤠
